text:
Upon installation I had recieved the following message:

(OS 10048)Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port)
is normally permitted.  : make_sock: could not bind to address 0.0.0.0:80
no listening sockets available, shutting down
Unable to open logs

I managed to overcome it by quitting Skype before installation. (had to 
uninstall and reinstall again).
creator: zilber2000@hotmail.com

text:
(OS 10048)Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port)
Is normally permitted. : make_sock: could not bind to address 0.0.0.0:80
No listening sockets available, shutting down

[Fri Apr 22 09:43:41 2005] [error] (OS 2)The system cannot find the file 
specified.

Win32 Source: httpd 2.0.54 win32 x86 src

With Service pack 1 Installed
creator: dodie.caballero@gmail.com

text:
Looks like you already have a web server running on port 80 -- IIS perhaps? 
Please try users@httpd.apache.org for further help.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> Upon installation I had recieved the following message:
> 
> (OS 10048)Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port)
> is normally permitted.  : make_sock: could not bind to address 0.0.0.0:80
> no listening sockets available, shutting down
> Unable to open logs
> 
> I managed to overcome it by quitting Skype before installation. (had to 
> uninstall and reinstall again).

If Skype was started before you started apache, you receive message above.
In Skype under Tools -> Options -> Advanced settings -> Connection:
Unmark (use port 80 and 443 as alternatives for incoming connections). Save options, quit Skype and start it again. Now you can start apache normaly.
creator: djordje.kornic@live.com

text: Thanks Ronen.  That was it.  I couldn't figure out what app was using the 80 port.  Just started learning stuff.
creator: qubbie@yahoo.com
